questions.question: What is the chemical formula of Co-MOF-α?
What type of adsorption isotherms does Co-MOF-β exhibit for C2H2, C2H4, and C2H6 at 195 K?

Does Co-MOF-β have a higher adsorption selectivity for C2H2 over CO2 or CH4 at 298 K and 1 atm?
What is the isosteric heat of adsorption (Qst) for C2H2 in Co-MOF-β?
Is the structural transformation from Co-MOF-α to Co-MOF-β reversible?
What is the calculated IAST selectivity of Co-MOF-β for C2H2/CO2 at 298 K and 1 atm?
Does Co-MOF-β exhibit a two-step CO2 adsorption isotherm at 195 K?

What is the Langmuir surface area of Co-MOF-β calculated from the first-step CO2 sorption isotherm at 195 K?

questions.answer: Higher amounts of C2 gases are adsorbed at 298 K than at 195 K below certain pressures

questions.question: What is the gate-opening pressure for C2H2 adsorption in Co-MOF-β at 195 K?
Does Co-MOF-β show a higher C2H2/CH4 selectivity compared to Fe-MOF at 298 K and 1 atm?
What is the significance of the structural flexibility of Co-MOF-β in terms of gas adsorption?
questions.answer: The structural flexibility allows Co-MOF-β to exhibit unique adsorption behaviors and high selectivity for certain gases
